Authors:
Cecilia Cristina Carmaran, Marcelo Facundo Berretta, Sofia
Ines Martinez , Viviana Andrea Barrera, Françoise Munaut, Amelia Laura
Gasoni
Title:
Species diversity of Cladorrhinum in Argentina and
description of a new species, Cladorrhinum australe
Keywords:
Cladorrhinum, molecular phylogeny, diversity, growth rate,
Argentina
Abstract:
The genus Cladorrhinum constitutes a fungal group of prime
importance for agriculture and livestock, since some species have
biocontrol potential or were shown to promote plant growth and to
produce phytases which are enzymes useful for processing animal feed. We
assessed the species diversity of Cladorrhinum in Argentina. Strains
were identified at the species level by analysis of morphological and
physiological characters, as well as using molecular characters, by
sequencing three nuclear DNA loci: internal transcribed spacer regions
(ITS), 28S ribosomal subunit and Î²-tubulin. Ex-type strains and
taxonomically established isolates of Cladorrhinum were used as
references. C. bulbillosum and C. samala were detected, and a new
species is described, as C australe
